intro: Cadaba stenopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kappaphycus, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula and parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
